item.title: Dumped Rubbish, 23rd November
item.description:
Contractors for DMS Properties cleared front garden of similar waste and within a few days the tenants at 54 Valley Road dumped more rubbish (including baby toys and a television) which should be taken to a recycling centre. It's an eyesore and encourages vermin. This is an ongoing problem which I seem to complain about regularly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Health& Safety hazard for kids, fridge abandoned, 23rd November
item.description:
Corroded fridge with exposed pipes abandoned for weeks, risk of falling and hurting young children of the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Grange, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned white trailer on Kidbrooke Grove, 23rd November
item.description:
Abandoned white trailer on Kidbrooke Grove - no number plate and has been there for a long time - Council has taken no action despite previous reports.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of priory park road and Tennyson road in the square., 23rd November
item.description:
See pictures. Large box without address & dismantled small bed leaning up against the raised bed. Usually I'd move the rubbish to the edge of the square for ease of collection but it's wet and I'm carrying a lot of stuff so left where it was

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Pavement, 23rd November
item.description:
The pavement is extremely damaged on bethwin road, brick are falling, cracked and crumbling. There are many places where it is very uneven and declining. The pavement is also far to high, elderly people really struggle stepping up and many people cannot open their car doors because it is so high . This has been reported for over 3 years now and nothing is being done yet streets that have no issues are resurfaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethwin Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
